question_sentence: At least thirteen people died in a vehicle crash ten miles from the U.S.-Mexico border Tuesday. What car was involved in the crash?
Why did Bachelor host Chris Harrison step away from the show?
choices: He was called out for retweeting anti-vax tweets
He was caught in ethnic wear at a Golden Globes afterparty
He violated social distancing guidelines on set
He initially defended a Bachelor contestant’s  racially insensitive behavior

question_sentence: This week, the House passed a police reform bill named after George Floyd. What is NOT in the provisions of the bill?
choices: Creating a national registry to track officers with  problematic records

question_sentence: Six books by which popular children's book author will no longer be published because of racist and insensitive imagery?
Which celebrity abruptly quit Twitter this week?
Which U.S. state would receive the LEAST money from Biden’s COVID-19 stimulus bill?
Which Biden cabinet nominee withdrew from consideration after bipartisan criticism of their Twitter, which occasionally criticized lawmakers?
Biden has announced that there will be a vaccine for every American by the end of which month?
Which two states are lifting mask mandates?
Civil rights icon Vernon Jordan died on Monday night. What on this list of items is he NOT known for?
choices: Being an adviser to Bill Clinton
Being an Omega Psi Phi member in college
Being an advisor to Iranian foreign policy

question_sentence: What is the name of the influential gathering of grassroots US conservatives at which Donald Trump gave his first major post-presidential speech?
A new analysis by the Daily Mail found that at least how many of the UK's police stations have closed in the past ten years?
Which EU country was the first to agree deals to buy Covid vaccines from Russia and China after breaking from the bloc’s joint procurement scheme?
How long was Nicola Sturgeon’s marathon appearance in front of the Holyrood inquiry into the handling of sexual abuse claims against Alex Salmond?
What is the self-given nickname of the group of royal aides who claim to have been bullied by Meghan Markle?
A pipe bomb exploded outside a Covid-19 testing centre this week in the latest anti-lockdown attack in which European country?
An MPs’ inquiry into abuses of power in the Armed Forces has been handed evidence from a total of around how many female serving personnel and veterans?
Rishi Sunak’s spring budget includes a planned hike in corporation tax from 19% to what?
Critics claim a newly announced cut in UK aid represents a ‘death sentence’ for which poverty-stricken country?
Which animal at San Diego Zoo has become the first non-human to receive a Covid vaccine outside of clinical trials?
Senate Democrats are hoping to pass the long-awaited Covid-19 relief bill this weekend. What was one of the big provisions in the bill that caused the most disagreement among progressive legislators?
evidence: Some progressive Democrats were pushing for the inclusion of a $15 minimum wage increase, but the provision was discouraged by the Senate’s parliamentarian, who weighs in on the body’s rules and procedures.

question_sentence: Books by this iconic children’s author shot to the top of bestseller lists after the group that preserves the author’s legacy announced six of their titles will no longer be published or sold because of racist depictions.
evidence: Fans and collectors seem to be stocking up on Dr. Seuss books after Dr. Seuss Enterprises announced they will no longer publish some of the famed author’s books because of his portrayals of Black and Asian characters.

question_sentence: The FDA has greenlit the US’ third Covid-19 vaccine option. What drugmaker produces it?
evidence: The Johnson & Johnson vaccine is different than the other two available vaccines in the US because it only requires one dose.

question_sentence: The United Nations is investigating whether war crimes have been committed in this east African nation, where violent conflict has been brewing since its Prime Minister launched military operations against regional leaders.
evidence: Details about a November massacre in an Ethiopian village have sparked international condemnation and prompted an investigation into human rights violations and possible war crimes.

question_sentence: Security around the US Capitol had to be increased around March because some fringe Trump supporters believed that was the day the former President was going to return and retake office. Why did they believe this?
choices: because “March 4” sounds like “march forth,” like a coded message
because March 4 was the “original” inauguration day
because 0304 is a special number in the Qanon world
because it is the anniversary of the passing of the 18th amendment
evidence: A group of Qanon and Trump supporters clung to a conspiracy theory that the “original” inauguration day, on which many early presidents were inaugurated, is the only constitutional inauguration day. They believed Trump was biding his time to return and take back power.

question_sentence: March is Women’s History Month, and the timing coincides with several important events. Which of these did NOT take place in the month of March?
choices: the passage of Title IX, which prohibits sex discrimination in all federally funded education programs
the passage of the The Equal Rights Amendment
the first major women’s suffrage parade
evidence: The 19th Amendment was passed in May of 1919. The ERA and Title IX were both passed in March of 1972.

question_sentence: Which childhood cartoon favorite is getting their own theme park in Orlando, Florida?
evidence: Peppa Pig, the animated British piglet, is getting her own tourist attraction – complete with muddy puddles that developers say will be great for very young park-goers.

question_sentence: Dozens of people have died in protests in this country after a military coup in early February upended the government and resulted in widespread suppression and unrest.
evidence: Myanmar’s military forces overtook the government and imprisoned several state leaders. Now, they are being accused of using deadly force against protesters.

question_sentence: Amazon quietly changed a redesign of its app logo after people compared it to what unfortunate image?
evidence: The app’s logo featured a jagged label and cheery smile that some people said gave off a very Hitler vibe. Amazon has since made a few tweaks to make it less Fuhrer-esque.

question_sentence: Finish the phrase: March comes in like a lion, and out like a ____.
choices: aging prizefighter with nothing to lose
evidence: While the saying most likely started as a reference to astronomy, since March begins in Leo season (a lion) and ends in Aries (a ram, or lamb), it quickly evolved into accurate summation of March’s changing seasonal weather  in the Northern Hemisphere.
